intro: Senecio pseudovernalis, commonly known as the African marguerite, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers, surrounded by white ray florets, bloom in spring and summer. Senecio pseudovernalis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
